thread.title: Take a local luxury break right on the Peninsula
thread.title_full: Take a local luxury break right on the Peninsula - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Paige Porter Fischer
title: Take a local luxury break right on the Peninsula
text:
Photo: Michael Short, Special To The Chronicle print_article_embed|photo-8455900|article-6458322|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8455900|article-6458322|1 email_share_embed|photo-8455900|article-6458322|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8455900|article-6458322|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8455900|article-6458322|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8455900|article-6458322|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8455900|article-6458322|5 google_share_embed|photo-8455900|article-6458322|6 Signs point visitors to various artists’ shops in the gardens of the Allied Arts Guild in Menlo Park. Signs point visitors to various artists’ shops in the gardens of...
Sometimes the best vacations don’t involve plane tickets, baggage fees and airport security lines. Often they are planned at the last minute — and require nothing more than your weekender bag, half a tank of gas and a sense of adventure. They’re called staycations, and part of their allure is the relative ease with which you’re able to escape everyday life. Signs point visitors to various artists’ shops in the gardens of the Allied Arts Guild in Menlo Park. Signs point visitors to various artists’ shops in the gardens of...
Sometimes the best vacations don’t involve plane tickets, baggage fees and airport security lines. Often they are planned at the last minute — and require nothing more than your weekender bag, half a tank of gas and a sense of adventure. They’re called staycations, and part of their allure is the relative ease with which you’re able to escape everyday life.
